intro: Cnidoscolus oligandrus var. xerophilus, commonly known as the Mexican giant water flea, is a variant of the genus Cnidoscolus, which belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family. This plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and is native to regions of Mexico and Central America. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, well-drained soils. The plant is notable for its ability to tolerate periods of drought, a trait that defines its varietal name "xerophilus." Its structure and growth habits make it an interesting subject for botanical study and horticultural cultivation.
